phrase.item: Burning incense
Melt the butter and then mix it with wheat flour, [so that] it becomes like dumplings.
Every new year [and] new month they put it in the oven on Friday morning so there won't be sickness, or they put it in the name of a dead person
Wicks
The wicks are made on two occasions: on the holidays of Qerbon and Ramazon.
A wick is made out of new cotton like this: Twist the cotton on behalf of whoever is dead and has holy places named for them,
Then they each make three or four. Then they heat the oil and dip the wicks in so it ignites nicely.
Half will be taken to the holy place, one will be burned at home around seven o'clock, at sunset.
The one inside the house they put on a stone on the edge of the oven.
An old mullah should recite some verses [from the Qur'an].
At the shabi chiroɣ ceremony [after a death] one wick is made very very long
The mullah holds that and recites.
When it is finished he puts it on the edge of the oven.
Sprinkling Flour
Sprinkling flour is used at the new year, the new month, weddings, for going and returning from the summer pasture, and when someone is going or coming from a journey.
The flour should be sprinkled on a person's right shoulder, or on the head of a flock.
However, at the New Year (ʃogen) no wood in the house, including all four pillars, should be left without flour marking.
Secondly, two sides of the oven you are allowed to mark (ptik)
Whoever goes on a journey takes a little bit of ash from the oven and puts it on the tongue of his shoe--if the person comes back safe, he kisses one or both sides of the oven.
Talisman.
Long ago, whenever someone got sick the mullah used to divine their fate
and then he wrote a talisman for the sick person.
The talisman was copied from an old book, and wrapped in this way:
It should be wrapped in white or red fabric
Then they make a band for it, and tie it on the arm, neck, or head.
Athother type is enfumer.
That is also written on the paper; someone who is sick burns it in two ways.
One wick enfumer is wrapped with green thread and then burned so the smoke goes to the sick person's nose.
Another one: They write one or two words on it then they put it on the fire with səpandr grass and jarzn seeds; the sick person holds their face over it.
It's said that it protects against evil or bad fortune from a fairy.
Kissing (hand)
When one hand reaches another hand quickly, each person kisses their own hand.
If he is a guest hold his hand and he will hold your hand; you kiss his hand and he will kiss yours, it's called greeting.
Another type of kissing: someone who likes being sweet kisses his/her face or eyes.
Some ladies kiss the old man's head.
Some old men offer their hands to women, and the women kiss their hands. Some women kiss old men's hands and the old men kiss the women on their heads.
Women kiss each other on the face.
Bergush
Whether it is true or not, it's said that in the world besides monsters, madmen, demons, and dragons, there was also something called Bergush
That person was both male and female.
It is told that as a man he got used to the pure woman.
First the lady loses her mind, she breaks all the tools or everything within reach.
When he gets used to being with that woman, he does only one thing whenever he comes: no matter how hard his work is, he thinks only about copulation.
It's also told that his belly is open, everything inside his belly is visible.
It's said that he plays musical instruments (rebob, chang, naj, ɟegek), and the accustomed lady gets drunk.
However, those who are not next to him won't be able to hear him; only the accustomed lady can hear his voice.
He has a habit that whatever the woman desires, he prepares and brings to her.
For example, in the winter when there is no fresh fruit, he brings her some.
If he sees anything dirty in that lady, he breaks everything and tears her clothes.
It is said that when he has a son, he will be very worthy--he will be called Bergushzoda
According to the old tradition it's said that if she is scared, a nice mullah can do her incantation.
But it's said that Bergush was also a smart mullah.
An ordinary person cannot separate him from her.
During the incantation, whoever is scholarly throws nabot [crystalized sugar] in front of the mullah.
This is the symbol of friendship or reconcilliation.
If the mullah cannot make him obey, he throws a stone or dirt in front of him.
This is a sign of not being friends with him, he considers human beings his enemy.
An old type of fortune telling is with grilled wheat.
Before people used to make grilled wheat.
It's known that it's not allowed to eat the grilled wheat until it's split in two.
But the grilled wheat is good for something else as well.
First, if someone's head is injured, they heat the grilled wheat and keep it on the injured head.
Also, grilled wheat is used as an omen.
When the grilled wheat is brought for eating then one can grab it and take it in one's hand
Whoever is in front of you will ask: "single or pair?" [i.e. odd or even]
That person will reply, single or pair.
Then the person who decide which to believe, single or pair.
Then he will eat them two at a time.
If it ends up matching what was in his mind--single or pair--all his wishes will come true.
